intro: Phlomoides angreni, commonly known as the Karakorum phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high elevations where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
